permalink-provider.name: Default (/yyyy/mm/dd/time-in-millis.html)
permalink-provider.description: Generates permalinks of the form /yyyy/mm/dd/time-in-millis.html (this is the default)

page-decorator.name: Facebook Connect Support
page-decorator.description: Provides support for other Facebook Connect plugins. This plugin is required to be enabled for the Facebook OpenId Comment Author Provider plugin to work. In order for this integration, you need a Facebook application ID, which needs to be configured below. For instructions on setting up a Facebook application, see here.

content-decorator.name: Blog Categories Decorator
content-decorator.description: Adds links from your blog entry back to your categories, for those categories associated with the blog entry.

content-decorator.name: Blog Tags Decorator
content-decorator.description: Adds links from your blog entry back to your tags, for those tags associated with the blog entry.

content-decorator.name: Disable Responses Decorator
content-decorator.description: Disables comments and TrackBacks for the blog entry. This is useful if you are worried about spam when you don't have access to your blog. Needs to be used in conjunction with the DisableResponseListener (for comments and TrackBacks).

content-decorator.name: Entry to PDF Decorator
content-decorator.description:
Adds link to your blog entries that allows export of the blog entry to PDF document. By default, PDF generation supports only "Latin 1" or ISO-8859-1 encoding (Asian, Hebrew, Arabic and Eastern European languages are not supported).

You can enable support for your chosen language during PDF generation, by placing TTF or OTF font file under: <PEBBLE_ROOT>/themes/_pebble/fonts/. Font file will be loaded dynamically at run time during PDF generation.

Note: CSS styles for PDF document template located in: <PEBBLE_ROOT>/themes/_pebble/pdf.css.

content-decorator.name: Escape Markup Decorator
content-decorator.description: Escapes some XML/HTML markup between <escape>...</escape> tags. This is useful where you would like to post large fragments of HTML, JSP, XML or Java code. In doing so, any < or > characters will be automatically escaped to &lt; and &gt; respectively.

content-decorator.name: Excerpt Decorator
content-decorator.description: Automatically creates an excerpt for blog entries if one doesn't already exist. Put this before the ReadMoreDecorator to ensure that "read more" links are also generated. The default maximum content length for truncation of the body is 255 characters.

content-decorator.name: HTML Decorator
content-decorator.description: Filters the HTML inside comments and TrackBacks to use only a limited, safe subset of HTML.

content-decorator.name: Enclose Entry In Div Decorator
content-decorator.description: Will enclose the content entry and all above plugins in a global DIV making it easier to differentiate them from the metainformation below in your CSS styling. The DIV id is [blogContentDecorated] for blog entries and [pageContentDecorated] for static pages.

content-decorator.name: No Follow Decorator
content-decorator.description: Adds links from your blog entry back to your categories, for those categories associated with the blog entry.

content-decorator.name: Radeox Decorator
content-decorator.description: Renders content inside blog entries and static pages between <wiki>...</wiki> tags using the Radeox library. Internal style wiki links (e.g. [aboutme]) link to the static page with the same name. If the static page doesn't exist, the link lets you create the page.

content-decorator.name: Read More Decorator
content-decorator.description: Adds a "Read more..." link to blog entries in the following cases if: the blog entry excerpt is not empty and the page being displayed is a summary page (i.e. home, month or day page); or the blog entry is aggregated (i.e. the original permalink has been specified).

content-decorator.name: Related Posts Decorator
content-decorator.description: Finds similar posts to the current within your posts. Similarity is determined by comparing the tags. The default number of related posts displayed is five (5).

content-decorator.name: Relative URI Decorator
content-decorator.description: Replaces relative URIs with absolute URLs so that they are rendered properly in browsers and newsreaders. For example, a link to <tt>./images/someimage.jpg</tt> would be transformed to <tt>http://localhost:8080/images/someimage.jpg</tt>.

content-decorator.name: Social Bookmarks Decorator
content-decorator.description: Adds recommendation links to popular social bookmarking sites to your blog entry. Currently included are: Slashdot, Digg, Reddit, Delicious and StumbleUpon

content-decorator.name: Fixed Text Decorator
content-decorator.description: Adds a fixed to every blog entry. The suffix may contain the tags ${blogEntry.title}, ${blogEntry.subtitle}, ${blogEntry.author}, ${blogEntry.id}, ${blogEntry.excerpt}, ${blogEntry.tags} or ${blogEntry.permalink} to include that property of the blog, and the property may be suffixed with ".encoded" to encode the value for use in a URL, eg ${blogEntry.permalink.encoded}.

content-decorator.name: Technorati Tags Decorator
content-decorator.description: Adds links from your blog entry back to tags on Technorati, for those tags associated with the blog entry.

content-decorator.name: Thumbnails Decorator
content-decorator.description:
Simple image thumbnail generator. Converts <thumbnail> tags into image thumbnails with a link to the original image, which will be displayed in a popup window when clicked. The following tag attributes are available:

  • src (mandatory) the URL of the image to be thumbnailed, which must be a locally-stored file, usually under /images
  • thumbSize the maximum dimension of the generated thumbnail
  • popupSize the size of the popup window
  • alt the alt attribute for the thumbnail

The CSS class for the thumbnail A tag is thumbnailLink and the class for the IMG tag is thumbnailImage.

content-decorator.name: TrackBack Auto-Discovery Decorator
content-decorator.description: Generates TrackBack Auto-Discovery links for blog entries. See the TrackBack Technical Specification for more details. To use this, you also need to configure the TrackBack Confirmation Strategy of your blog to be the NoOpConfirmationStrategy.

blog-entry-listener.name: XML RPC Notification Listener
blog-entry-listener.description: Sends an XML-RPC update notification ping when a blog entry is published.

blog-entry-listener.name: Email blog owner
blog-entry-listener.description: Sends a notification e-mail to the blog owner when a new blog entry is added, changed or published.

blog-entry-listener.name: Mark Unpublished
blog-entry-listener.description:
Marks all new and changed blog entries to be unpublished, so that they require approval from the blog owner before being published on the blog. Only the following subset of properties, when changed, will cause a blog entry to be marked as unpublished.
  • Title
  • Subtitle
  • Excerpt
  • Body
  • Original permalink

blog-entry-listener.name: Post to twitter
blog-entry-listener.description: Post the title and a tinyurl to twitter when a new blog entry is published.

blog-entry-listener.name: Run blog entries through W3C Tidy
Publish blog entries to PubSubHubBub
blog-entry-listener.description: Notifies a PubSubHubBub Hub that a blog feed has changed.

comment-listener.name: Mark all comments pending
comment-listener.description: Marks all new comments with a status of pending so that they require approval from a blog contributor before being published on the blog.

comment-listener.name: IP address spam check
comment-listener.description:
Maintains both a blacklist and a whitelist of IP addresses, performing the following when a new comment is added.
  1. If the IP address of the comment is contained within the blacklist, the comment is marked as pending and the comment's spam score is increased by 1 point.
  2. Otherwise, if the IP address of the comment is contained within the whitelist, the comment is left as-is.
  3. Otherwise, if the IP address of the comment is contained in neither list, the comment is marked as pending and the spam score remains unaffected.
In addition to this, the comment's IP address is removed from the blacklist (if applicable) and added to the whitelist when it is approved. Vice versa for comments that are rejected.

comment-listener.name: Regex spam check
comment-listener.description: Checks the content of new comments for specific regular expressions. If the number of occurences is greater than the threshold, the comment is marked as pending and the comment's spam score is increased by 1 point. This is repeated for the title, author and website properties too. The default threshold for the number of occurences is 0.

comment-listener.name: Link spam check
comment-listener.description: Checks the content of new comments for the number of links that they contain. If this is greater than the threshold, the comment is marked as pending and the comment's spam score is increased by 1 point. The default threshold for the number of links is 3.

comment-listener.name: Reject comment if it exceeds a spam score
comment-listener.description: Checks the spam score of new comments and if greater than the threshold, the comment is marked as rejected. The default threshold is 1.

comment-listener.name: Mark all comments approved
comment-listener.description: Marks all new comments with a status of pending so that they require approval from a blog contributor before being published on the blog.

comment-listener.name: Delete rejected comments
comment-listener.description: Deletes new comments that have been marked as rejected.

comment-listener.name: Disable all comments
comment-listener.description: Deletes new comments, effectively disabling the ability for readers to leave comments.

comment-listener.name: Email blog author and comment authors
comment-listener.description:
Sends a notification e-mail when a new comment is added.
  • If the status of the comment is pending, an e-mail is sent to the blog entry author asking for approval.
  • If the status of the comment is approved, an e-mail is sent to the blog entry author and all comment authors for the blog entry that have left their e-mail addresses.

comment-listener.name: Email blog owner and comment authors
comment-listener.description:
Sends a notification e-mail when a new comment is added.
  • If the status of the comment is pending, an e-mail is sent to the blog owner asking for approval.
  • If the status of the comment is approved, an e-mail is sent to the blog owner and all comment authors for the blog entry that have left their e-mail addresses.

comment-confirmation-strategy.name: Default
comment-confirmation-strategy.description: Asks the reader to confirm their action by clicking a button. This is the simplest strategy but also one that automated spambots can easily work around.

comment-confirmation-strategy.name: Image Captcha
comment-confirmation-strategy.description: Asks the reader to confirm their action by entering the text they see in a distorted image.

comment-confirmation-strategy.name: No Op
comment-confirmation-strategy.description: A strategy that doesn't require comments/TrackBacks to be confirmed. Use this if you want to leave comment/TrackBack spam detection to the set of configured comment listeners instead of introducing a manual step in the process. Also use this strategy if you intend to enable TrackBack Auto-Discovery.

comment-confirmation-strategy.name: Simple Maths
comment-confirmation-strategy.description: Asks the reader to confirm their action by answering a simple maths question based on the addition, subtraction or multiplication of two numbers between 1 and 10.

comment-confirmation-strategy.name: reCAPTCHA
comment-confirmation-strategy.description: Asks the reader to confirm their action by entering the text they see in a distorted image. Makes use of reCAPTCHA technology.

open-id-comment-author-provider.name: Facebook OpenID Comment Author Provider
open-id-comment-author-provider.description: Provides the ability for users to supply their user details from Facebook when commenting. Requires Facebook Connect Support page decorator to be enabled and configured in order to work.

trackback-listener.name: Mark all TrackBacks pending
trackback-listener.description: Marks all new TrackBacks with a status of pending so that they require approval from a blog contributor before being published on the blog.

trackback-listener.name: IP address spam check
trackback-listener.description:
Maintains both a blacklist and a whitelist of IP addresses, performing the following when a new TrackBack is added.
  1. If the IP address of the TrackBack is contained within the blacklist, the TrackBack is marked as pending and the TrackBack's spam score is increased by 1 point.
  2. Otherwise, if the IP address of the TrackBack is contained within the whitelist, the TrackBack is left as-is.
  3. Otherwise, if the IP address of the TrackBack is contained in neither list, the TrackBack is marked as pending and the spam score remains unaffected.
In addition to this, the TrackBack's IP address is removed from the blacklist (if applicable) and added to the whitelist when it is approved. Vice versa for TrackBacks that are rejected.

trackback-listener.name: Regex spam check
trackback-listener.description: Checks the content of new TrackBacks for specific regular expressions. If the number of occurences is greater than the threshold, the TrackBack is marked as pending and the TrackBack's spam score is increased by 1 point. This is repeated for the title, author and website properties too. The default threshold for the number of occurences is 0.

trackback-listener.name: Links spam check
trackback-listener.description: Checks the content of new TrackBacks for the number of links that they contain. If this is greater than the threshold, the TrackBack is marked as pending and the TrackBack's spam score is increased by 1 point. The default threshold for the number of links is 3.

trackback-listener.name: Reject trackback if it exceeds a spam score
trackback-listener.description: Checks the spam score of new TrackBacks and if greater than the threshold, the TrackBack is marked as rejected. The default threshold is 1.

trackback-listener.name: Mark all trackbacks approved
trackback-listener.description: Marks all new TrackBacks with a status of approved so that they appear on your blog immediately. This is useful for internal blogs where you aren't worried about spam and don't need TrackBacks to be approved before being published.

trackback-listener.name: Delete rejected trackbacks
trackback-listener.description: Deletes new TrackBacks that have been marked as rejected.

trackback-listener.name: Delete all trackbacks
trackback-listener.description: Deletes new TrackBacks, effectively disabling the ability for readers to leave TrackBacks.

trackback-listener.name: Email blog entry author
trackback-listener.description: Sends a notification e-mail when a new TrackBack is added to the blog entry author, additionally asking for approval if the status of the TrackBack is pending.

trackback-listener.name: Email blog owner
trackback-listener.description: Sends a notification e-mail when a new TrackBack is added to the blog owner, additionally asking for approval if the status of the TrackBack is pending.

trackback-confirmation-strategy.name: Default
trackback-confirmation-strategy.description: Asks the reader to confirm their action by clicking a button. This is the simplest strategy but also one that automated spambots can easily work around.

trackback-confirmation-strategy.name: Image Captcha
trackback-confirmation-strategy.description: Asks the reader to confirm their action by entering the text they see in a distorted image.

trackback-confirmation-strategy.name: No Op
trackback-confirmation-strategy.description: A strategy that doesn't require comments/TrackBacks to be confirmed. Use this if you want to leave comment/TrackBack spam detection to the set of configured comment listeners instead of introducing a manual step in the process. Also use this strategy if you intend to enable TrackBack Auto-Discovery.

trackback-confirmation-strategy.name: Simple Maths
trackback-confirmation-strategy.description: Asks the reader to confirm their action by answering a simple maths question based on the addition, subtraction or multiplication of two numbers between 1 and 10.

logger.name: Default Logger
logger.description: A logger that writes log files in the the Combined Log Format. This is the default logger.

logger.name: None
logger.description: A no-op logger that can be used when Pebble logging isn't required, such as when something like Apache provides the necessary logging already. Pebble will not capture any statistics when this logger is used.

feed-decorator.name: PubSubHubBub Feed Decorator
feed-decorator.description: Decorates Atom feeds with PubSubHubBub hub links, so that subscribers can subscribe to a hub for PUSH updates to feeds. Note, if you enable this plugin, you MUST enable both the PubSubHubBub blog entry listener, and the PubSubHubBub comment listener, otherwise feed aggregators will not poll, but rather expect push updates from the hub.
